Header: Three dead, several wounded after air strikes in northwest Syria
Content: The aftermath of air strikes in northwest Syria which are believed to have killed three people. The Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, a UK-based war monitor said the attacks killed three and wounded four more from the same family, including three women. The air strikes were carried out on the rebel-held city by Syrian government forces. Syrian President Bashar al-Assad announced the end of the “big battles” to take over the province of Idlib, the last stronghold of the rebels who want to overthrow him, while expressing his determination to restore the authority of the country.
